byline.contributor: Alan Wong and Michael Forsythe contributed reporting.

abstract: Plan to change chief executive selection process for Hong Kong causes protesters, police and lawmakers to converge on Legislative Council where proposal will be debated; supporters of Beijing-backed method say it expands voters' voice in election but others object because plan limits candidates to nominating committee list.
lead_paragraph: The security presence in and around the Legislative Council was high after heated protests last year over the plan, which would allow a direct vote for the territory’s leader.

headline.main: Hong Kong Lawmakers Begin Debate Over Election Plan
headline.print_headline: Election Plan Is Debated in Hong Kong

snippet: The security presence in and around the Legislative Council was high after heated protests last year over the plan, which would allow a direct vote for the territory’s leader.
